technology.title: CEO of spyware maker Memento Labs confirms one of its government customers was caught using its malware - TechCrunch
technology.description: Security researchers found a government hacking campaign that relies on Windows spyware developed by surveillance tech maker Memento Labs. When reached by TechCrunch, the spyware maker's chief executive blamed a government customer for getting caught.

technology.title: New World: Aeternum Is Ending New Content After Season 10 - GameSpot
technology.description: Players will still be able to revisit New World: Aeternum for now, but there won't be any more seasons or DLC.

technology.title: Super Mario 3D All-Stars Updated To Version 1.1.4, Improves Gameplay On Switch 2 - Nintendo Life
Gemini coming to Google TV Streamer, more devices this winter - 9to5Google
technology.description: In starting the Gemini for Home assistant preview, Google also shared when Gemini for Google TV is coming to the Google TV Streamer.

business.title: Stock Market Today: Dow Futures Rise Ahead of Fed Rate Decision - The Wall Street Journal
business.description: The Federal Reserve is expected to cut interest rates again. Plus, earnings heat up and President Trump is in Asia to talk trade. Follow along for live updates and reaction from the Dow, Nasdaq, S&P 500 and other markets.

business.title: Wall Street ticks higher ahead of Fed's rate decision; Trump’s Asian tour sends Nikkei to a record - AP News
business.description: Shares are mostly higher in Asia and Japan's benchmark Nikkei 225 index has surged more than 2% to another record. U.S. futures were mixed early Wednesday and oil prices were little changed. Upbeat comments by U.S. President Donald Trump on relations with maj…

business.title: Paramount Layoffs Begin; CEO David Ellison Says Cuts Are Key To Building “Strong, Future-Focused Company” - Deadline
business.description: Paramount has begun significant layoffs this morning, with about 1,000 U.S.-based workers being let go today, and roughly another 1,000 soon to follow.

business.title: Everyone thinks AI is replacing factory workers, but Amazon's layoffs show it's coming for middle management first - Fortune
business.description: As Amazon slashes 14,000 white-collar roles and the U.S. approaches a million job cuts this year, AI’s first major labor casualty might be emerging.

business.title: Boeing stems cash burn for first time since 2023 but takes $4.9 billion charge on 777X delays - CNBC
business.description: Boeing reported third-quarter results before the market opens on Wednesday.
